alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 7:17PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Platte County through 745 PM MDT... At 717 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Bordeaux, or 13 miles south of Wheatland, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slater and Bordeaux. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 59 and 74. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County
